intro: Spermacoce lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Spermacoce lanceolata is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain areas.
